body: IN the 1630's, the Dutch farmers who settled in Brooklyn at what is now the corner of Flatbush and Flatlands Avenues looked around them, saw marshes, a bay and very little high ground and appropriately dubbed the area Flatlands. Not until the post-World War II building boom did Flatlands become a heavily populated residential area, but when it did,
title: IF YOU'RE THINKING OF LIVING IN: FLATLANDS

body: Frank Zuccaro steps out of his patrol car, gun at his side, but without the badge of a New York City police officer. For the people who live along his beat in the Canarsie section of Brooklyn, however, the absence of the silver shield does not matter. Mr. Zuccaro is part of a private security patrol, paid for by homeowners and tenants who feel that
title: PRIVATE SECURITY PATROLS ON RISE IN CITY'S MIDDLE-CLASS AREAS

body: A Brooklyn man was killed and four other men were wounded yesterday in what the police described as a gangland-style shooting in front of a coffee shop in the Bensonhurst section at 2:15 A.M. There were no arrests. The dead man was identified as Dominick Cina, 23 years old, of 2063 East 34th Street in the Marine Park section. Vito Russo, 53, of
title: THE CITY; Brooklyn Man Is Slain on Street

body: THE performance in Central Park last night of Tchaikovsky's ''1812'' Overture, with Zubin Mehta leading the New York Philharmonic, would have been difficult to recreate in the concert hall. It was part of the opening concert in the 19th season of the orchestra's parks concerts and, according to the police, it attracted the largest audience ever for
title: PHILHARMONIC FILLS PARK WITH PEOPLE AND PICNICS

body: Friday ITALIAN FOLK MUSIC REVIVED Although Italian folk music was a vital part of daily life among early Italian immigrants, it isn't well known to later Italian-American generations, according to the Ethnic Folk Arts Center, which has set out to help rectify the situation. The center is touring Italian-American communities in the Northeast with
title: WEEKENDER GUIDE

body: The 19th season of the New York Philharmonic's free Parks Concerts will begin Aug. 8 at 8 P.M. on the Great Lawn in Central Park. For the first time, there will also be a concert at Battery Park in lower Manhattan, Aug. 23 at 12:30 P.M. The orchestra will also present concerts in Queens, the Bronx, Staten Island, Brooklyn and Long Island. The
title: PHILHARMONIC PARKS CONCERTS

body: THIS is an era when a piece of penny candy rarely costs less than a nickel, so perhaps it is not surprising that a pair of tickets to the Metropolitan Opera can set the buyer back $100 or more. However, last night a crowd estimated at 75,000 people took advantage of one of New York's perennial bargains and came to the Great Lawn of Central Park to
title: 'LUCIA' OPENS OPERA SEASON IN PARKS

body: The Metropolitan Opera will open its 17th season of parks concerts with a performance of Donizetti's ''Lucia di Lammermoor'' June 14 on Central Park's Great Lawn. This eight-performance series will include four performances of ''Lucia'' and four of Puccini's ''Boheme. The other ''La Boheme'' performances will be on June 15 at the Botanical Gardens,
title: June 14 'Lucia' to Open Opera Season in Parks

body: Decibels and Motorcycles T he parking lot at the Marine Park municipal golf course on Flatbush Avenue in Brooklyn was a sea of varooming motorcycles last night. If some City Council members have their way, motorcycles will be banned on residential streets in New York between 9 P.M. and 8 A.M., and that's what brought the two-wheelers out in force
title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY

title: COMPARATIVE PRICING HELPS IN RELOCATION
